query: If the number \[\frac{1}{2} \left(\frac{5}{\sqrt[3]{3} + \sqrt[3]{2}} + \frac1{\sqrt[3]{3} -\sqrt[3]{2}}\right)\]can be expressed in the form $\sqrt[3]{a} + \sqrt[3]{b},$ where $a$ and $b$ are integers, compute $a+b.$
ground_truth: We rationalize each of the fractions in parentheses, by using the sum and difference of cubes identities. First, we have \[\begin{aligned} \frac{5}{\sqrt[3]{3} + \sqrt[3]{2}} &= \frac{5\left(\sqrt[3]{9} - \sqrt[3]{6} + \sqrt[3]{4}\right)}{\left(\sqrt[3]{3} + \sqrt[3]{2}\right)\left(\sqrt[3]{9} - \sqrt[3]{6} + \sqrt[3]{4}\right)} \\ &= \frac{5\left(\sqrt[3]{9}-\sqrt[3]{6}+\sqrt[3]{4}\right)}{3+2} \\ &= \sqrt[3]{9} - \sqrt[3]{6} + \sqrt[3]{4}. \end{aligned}\]Similarly,  \[\begin{aligned} \frac{1}{\sqrt[3]{3} - \sqrt[3]{2}} &= \frac{\sqrt[3]{9} + \sqrt[3]{6} + \sqrt[3]{4}}{\left(\sqrt[3]{3} - \sqrt[3]{2}\right)\left(\sqrt[3]{9} + \sqrt[3]{6} + \sqrt[3]{4}\right)} \\ &= \frac{\sqrt[3]{9}+\sqrt[3]{6}+\sqrt[3]{4}}{3 - 2} \\ &= \sqrt[3]{9} + \sqrt[3]{6} + \sqrt[3]{4}. \end{aligned}\]Therefore,\[\begin{aligned} \frac{1}{2} \left(\frac{5}{\sqrt[3]{3} + \sqrt[3]{2}} + \frac1{\sqrt[3]{3} -\sqrt[3]{2}}\right) &= \frac{1}{2} \left(\left(\sqrt[3]{9}-\sqrt[3]{6}+\sqrt[3]{4}\right) + \left(\sqrt[3]{9}+\sqrt[3]{6}+\sqrt[3]{4}\right) \right) \\ &= \sqrt[3]{9} + \sqrt[3]{4}, \end{aligned}\]so $a+b=9+4=\boxed{13}.$

\[
\frac{1}{x - y} = \frac{x + y}{(x - y)(x + y)} = \frac{x + y}{x^2 - y^2}
\]

Next, notice that \( x^2 - y^2 = (\sqrt[3]{3})^2 - (\sqrt[3]{2})^2 = \sqrt[3]{9} - \sqrt[3]{4} \).

\[
\frac{5}{x + y} + \frac{x + y}{x^2 - y^2}

\[
\frac{5(x^2 - y^2) + (x + y)^2}{(x + y)(x^2 - y^2)}
\]

\[
(x + y)^2 = x^2 + 2xy + y^2 = \sqrt[3]{3}^2 + 2\sqrt[3]{3}\sqrt[3]{2} + \sqrt[3]{2}^2 = \sqrt[3]{9} + 2\sqrt[3]{6} + \sqrt[3]{4}
\]

\[
\frac{5(x^2 - y^2) + (x + y)^2}{(x + y)(x^2 - y^2)} = \frac{5(\sqrt[3]{9} - \sqrt[3]{4}) + (\sqrt[3]{9} + 2\sqrt[3]{6} + \sqrt[3]{4})}{(x + y)(x^2 - y^2)}
\]

\[
